Reviews.Title: It's a great phone - but not the best camera
Reviews.Author: WinKy
Reviews.Content: I bought this rather inexpensive phone for a trip to Ireland and England this month.  The phone was crystal clear in its operation when I called the USA from Europe.  But to function as a camera - it's not the best.  Also, I was unable to find a good user's manual which detailed how the phone's menu worked.  I went to the manufacturers website and found nothing about the menuing system - that was frustrating.  So, I had to just sit down by trial and error learning what the menu did.  That was very frustrating, too.  So, after I learned how the unit worked by trial and error, I found the phone to have lots of capability for the price I paid for it.  I now like the phone but I did not like the process by which I learned to use it.  One final thing - use the ROAM SIMPLE service for low cost international telephoning - they are great!

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: Raj
Reviews.Content: Works well in India. It was a gift and the person I gifted this to indicated they lilke the product. So all in all it saved my name and money, thanks!

Reviews.Title: Cheap phone
Reviews.Author: Chief Jo
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for my son for his first phone.  It really is cheap.  So far he loves it.  Issues so far, listening to FM radio with headphones, volume is way too loud, even at the bottom setting before no sound at all, it's too loud, have to use a headphone with separate volume controls.  The music player will not add the music on the Micro sd card.  He can only listen to the songs one at a time.  The user manual is garbage.  I will spend a little more for a better phone if he breaks this one or loses it.  For his first phone it is fine though.

Reviews.Title: Might be for you, might not be.
Reviews.Author: Nuwanee
Reviews.Content: For those who need two cell numbers for one reason or another (and therefore two SIM cards), I'm sure this is an excellent phone. Especially if you speak Spanish, since the default settings are apparently Spanish. I did not expect that. It might be a nice thing to add to the description. I'm glad I know enough Spanish to have changed the settings.In my opinion, there's no point in it even having a QWERTY keypad, since the messaging system is unnecessarily complex and hard to use.I actually got it because I needed a cheap replacement for my phone with a QWERTY keypad, because mine was ignoring calls without alerting me to the missed call. At least I could check my voice-mail with the old one, though. The only way I have found to even GET to my voice-mail (and I am reasonably tech-savvy) is by having someone leave a message, after which it will prompt me...which would be...workable...if it weren't for the fact that I'm apparently supposed to know and input the number for my voice-mail myself. Every other phone I've ever had automatically had that number, presumably based on my service connection for my specific phone number.However it works, it has always just worked, and I have no clue how to access my voice-mail now.I am very seriously considering reverting back to my old phone, despite unwittingly missing calls frequently.Of course, being a small phone, if you have large fingers, you will find yourself unable to use the QWERTY keypad whenever you do actually need to. This is no issue to me, as I have small hands, but it's just fair warning.I'm glad to be able to comfortably talk on the phone again, since my old phone always had mediocre call quality, but I'm not sure it's worth the trade, since I text more than I talk. I have found texting to be a quick, easy, and efficient way to relay information throughout the day without actually disturbing my or any else's day with a full phone conversation (or multiple!)- and this puts a bit of a damper on my usual mode of conversation.I also have yet to convince it to be on simple "vibrate only" mode. I don't like it making noise while I am at work, but I DO like to know if I have a call or get a message I need to check later. Silent mode doesn't allow me to know when someone IS trying to contact me.Honestly, my experience with this phone has been trying.There are a variety of features it has that I don't need and couldn't care less for, such as access to FaceBook and such. I have come to expect this out of any phone with a QWERTY keypad, though. Apparently, comfortable texting also equals 500 functions for keeping "connected" via every possible avenue with everyone you know, and all the ones you don't actually know, too. I wish I could just find a phone with easy, comprehensive texting; easy, clear phone calls; perhaps an easy-to-use calendar planner system; and maybe a few games and a decent camera.

Reviews.Title: "LOL" as some might put it.
Reviews.Author: L. kokoszka "kombat pikachu"
Reviews.Content: It is a 35 dollar phone.  Five stars!  Now here are the things I have been curious about.App break down.There is a facebook icon on the main screen.  The graphic is misleading.  It just takes to to the blu club screen.Blu club-seems to be the main apps offered for the phone for social purposes.  It has twitter (this one displays parts of tweets. You have to expand each one to find out what people tweeted in 140 chars or whatever it is that the limit is. Facebook- seems to be just facebook messenger and mail.  No actual wall posts, which is good since you won't be frustrated with 2g downloads of memes.  Gmaes-seems to just hold facebook, twitter and yahoo messenger shortcuts.  Perhaps the games go there? Yahoo Messenger- I guess just im service.  I do not have an account, so I won't bother checking.In order to use any of the apps you must have an sd card installed.There is a  blu store that has an handful of little apps you can download.  Nothing i would care about.I have put an 8gig card in my phone, and filled it half way with music.  I was worried that the phone would take too long to navigate such a massive amount of storage, but it handles it very well.  The music is organized by artist, and track number.  Only it is a single list, so if you have a lot of songs on there, get ready to scroll. Once it is playing, it is playing.Videos seem to be in avi format.  You have to change the settings to store to sd card.  I do not know why the default is internal memory, since that is non existent as stated in another review. Tried putting some avi movies on it, but that failed.I thought it would have email, but all that is on the phone is a push messenger, which I suppose is for the use with twitter, facebook and yahoo chat.  I guess one less app to worry aboutPhysical.The phone is small.  I like it like that. Fits in all my pockets.  it is very lightweight. plastic lightweight, but at the same time feels like an etch a sketch, so I do not think it will break anytime.  The keys sound like bubble wrap. Maybe not as loud, but nothing I would use when people are meditating near by.  The wheel in the center did give me trouble sometimes by going diagonally sometimes when in the menu.There is no volume button.  There are sound profiles that are accessed in the main screen, by going up above the bottom row of tiles.  It is very easy to miss if you do not know what you are looking for. There is very few audio tones built in, but you can set your own from file when you customize the profile.Instruction manual sucks.  This phone was not made for america.  There is an adapter for us socket, that you plug the european socket into, that has a usb port.  You have to use all three, unless you are not in America.  It uses a standardized micro usb i think they call them.  Same plug that is used in android devices.

Reviews.Title: Great phone.. SD card help
Reviews.Author: james
Reviews.Content: this is a great phone for all your phone needs. Now when you put in a SD card and plug it in the phone and the SD card show up on different files the SD card is under drive D the phone is not.

Reviews.Title: great value for a great product
Reviews.Author: Loh Chin Fei
Reviews.Content: it's cheap, dual sim, bluetooth, and easy to use. I only needed a spare phone that does simple messaging and calls. this is more than what I expected.

Reviews.Title: Hard to find support
Reviews.Author: Sarah Nasir
Reviews.Content: The reason I am rating this a 3 is because:Pros:Fulfills the basic phoning needs such as calling, easy texting with QWERTY keypad, cheap no-contract phone. Dual sim may come in handy in overseas travel with GSM bandwidths.Cons:Major downside: Cant access my SIM numbers. It is now blocked. I use AT&T; subscription & i had never reset my pin before, & in the process of trying to access my saved SIM contacts, i used the default access code & it got blocked. So this brings to my 2nd con point.No customer support contact! The dinky user manual the phone comes with doesnt address this at all. multiple web searches havent yielded any helpful results neither. The phone is designed by some company called BLU in Miami. If anyone can help me figure this out, i'll really appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: GOOD BUY
Reviews.Author: rose
Reviews.Content: WANTED SOMETHING FOR USED SINCE I EASILY DAMAGE MY CELL PHONE, PERFECT FOR WHEN I TRAAVEL OUTSIDE THE COUNTRY WILL BUY ANOTHER.

Reviews.Title: i dont like this phone
Reviews.Author: andy
Reviews.Content: I try to bought this phone in the picture looks good and pretty big but when i receive it is an small phone, the pciture is not acurate, small keys is dificult to press, the camera is bag, taking bad pictures i do not recomend to buy this phone I returned but the costumer services of this company ( not amazon ) didn't answer my request i had to use amazon costumer service, then I could returned.

Reviews.Title: User instructions
Reviews.Author: Dennis G. Dorn
Reviews.Content: I think better instructions are needed.  I really like the quad-band feature and the capabilityof using two sim cards is really handy.

Reviews.Title: cute simple phone
Reviews.Author: Tatiana
Reviews.Content: The phone is cheap, so I do not expect from it any more than just calling and texting.Pros1)full qwerty keyboard2)elegant appearance (light, small, comfortable in a hand, beautiful red accents)3)cheap4)unlocked5)dual SIM (but I do not use it)Cons1) Very bad manual. It is not even a manual, but a waste of paper. I spent at least 20 minutes trying to find the way to lock the keyboard2) sometimes requires too much actions to make basic stuff like sending messages to a particular number. But you can get used to it.3)the camera is useless. Instead, they would better do a flashlight for the phone, or just do it without anything and even cheaper.I would give 4.5 starts because of the manual.Otherwise, it fully satisfied my expectations. I use H2O $10 plan and the phone is ideal for this.

Reviews.Title: It's complicated
Reviews.Author: A. Hubbard
Reviews.Content: I still don't really know how to use it. It has spots for 2 sim cards; I don't know what the second spot is for.

Reviews.Title: Small...basic...temporary fix
Reviews.Author: Paul Esposito
Reviews.Content: No frills phone.  Ok for non-techies & older folks who need onnly basic functions.  Definately smaller than anticipated; though you can't beat the price.  It's unlocked & works; so I'm pretty satisfied with the purchase.  An unlocked phone was needed for an uipcoming over-seas vacation.  Will be throwing this one out when I get back.

Reviews.Title: Poor operation
Reviews.Author: Sylvia Marlene Jones
Reviews.Content: In less than 4 months keyboard key totally stuck, will not operate. Date setting is the worst, will not hold the setting, involuntarily changes. Awaiting Seller's response, purchased phone March 2013.

Reviews.Title: Bought two of these for one time use overseas
Reviews.Author: Kristian Burkhardt
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad little phone for texting.  The good:- Battery life is great, especially compared to an iphone- Keyboard worked fine for me- my 9yo twins had zero trouble making it work- my 70yo parents had zero trouble making it workThe bad:- clunky user interfaceI would not choose this for an everyday phone, but for my purpose, they were great.

Reviews.Title: Well Done
Reviews.Author: Michael Sserunjoji
Reviews.Content: Just the right gift for a family and freind back in africa. They are going to love it. Product exceeded my expectation. But could do with a set of headphones

Reviews.Title: This phone does not work well
Reviews.Author: Faiz
Reviews.Content: I have tried this phone for about three months and I have to say it really does not work well. The problem is that it cuts off phone calls abruptly and without any reason. And when you make calls it takes a long time to process the call and at times simply will not do so. It could happen while you are walking, it could happen while you are sitting at home. So you have a phone that does not call reliably and a phone that does not pick up calls reliably.  May I also add that it also does not at times ring when people call? It is a shame since it is a cute phone and rather inexpensive. But I am now convinced the phone is cheap because it is badly made, and it is better to spend good money and get a proper phone. This is the second Blu phone I have purchased and both of them had similar problems and were not reliable. I will not be buying any more phones from this company and do not recommend their products at all. They make poor quality products.

Reviews.Title: don't buy
Reviews.Author: Denish Rampaul
Reviews.Content: the device has a charging device that don't even make proper contact with the plug adapter.the device stopped working after two weeks.beware of this phone the price is good but the product is no good

Reviews.Title: Worked for Studying Abroad
Reviews.Author: Regino Flores
Reviews.Content: This phone let me talk to people in England, where I studied, and was able to connect to their network easily. It did take a strong beating from me and though it was trusty, I did not like the interface as it was quite difficult to navigate. It worked for my trip, though! Thank you.

ProductInfo.Features:
This unlocked cell phone is compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T; and T-Mobile. Not all carrier features may be supported. It will not work with CDMA carriers like Verizon Wireless, Alltel and Sprint.
Unlocked Quad-Band GSM cell phone compatible with 850/900/1800/1900 MHz frequencies (Both SIMs) plus GPRS/WAP data capabilities.
1.3MP Camera; QWERTY Keyboard; Social Networking Integration; Stereo FM radio; MP3 player; MP3 ringtones and MicroSD slot upgradeable up to 8 GB.
Games; Browser WAP 2.0/xHTML; SMS; MMS; Organizer; GPRS Class 10 (4+1/3+2 slots), 32 - 48 kbps; Internal Memory 64 MB + 32 MB and MicroUSB v2.0.
Talk time up to 3 hrs - Stand-by up to 168 hrs.
ProductInfo.Name: BLU Q53-RED Samba JR Unlocked Dual SIM Quad-Band GSM Phone with 1.3MP Camera, QWERTY Keypad, FM Radio/MP3 Player - US Warranty - Red
